text: 22oz bottle pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Delicious coffee, cinnamon and bourbon balances so well.

Dark and thick pour. Sweet throughout. Cinnamon and light roasted coffee, Bourbon, vanilla, light oak, chocolate, light molasses. Rich and sweet. The cinnamon infusion is nice without adding heat. Medium slick body. Very nice and an enjoyable twist.
Bottle @ Solar Eclipse part 3 - The Darkest Night. Black body with a small offwhite head. Lots of cinnamon, bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, wood, caramel, smooth, oak. Very well balanced.

Bottle at Solar Eclipse part 3 - the darkest hours. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, overriped fruits with notes of hops, cinnamon and bourbon. Starts sweet but finish bitter with lingering roasted notes. Medium and oily. A great one...

Bottle at Solar Eclipse Part 3: The Darkest Hours. It pours dark brown with a creamy beige head. The aroma is spicy and medium roasted with notes of cinnamon and oak. Vanilla and toffee. Velvety and roasted flavour with cinnamon sticks and vanilla. Some bitter coffee notes. Long toffee and oaky finish. Some alcoholic notes. A true sipper.

2015. Bottle @ Sanderslum Pubbens Vintage launch/Solar Eclipse pt. 3. - The darkest hours. Pours black with a small creamy white head. Fudgy vanilla, cinnamon, coffee and caramel. Smooth and hella slick and vinous. Dope.

Bottle @ SEP3DH. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of cinnamon, vanilla, choko, cookie dough, slight vanilla, barrel, oaky, creamy, quite alot of spices. Taste is heavy sweet, loads of cinnamon, overly creamy and choko, milky. Heavy
Dark brown. Thick mocha head. Whoa, so much vanilla and cinnamon (in a good way.) Sweet. Boozy. Thick. Certainly a dessert beer. Thx andrewje41!

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2017 Bottle shared with koleminer20, Gus, and Aaron for Gus Birthday Part 2. Aroma is cinnamon bomb, coffee, roasted malt, caramel, amazing. Appearance is dark dark brown, light brown head, poured thickish. Taste is cinnamon, coffee, caramel, vanilla, roasted malt, booze, barrel, bourbon, amazing. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, lingering cinnamon, coffee and barrel aftertaste. Overall, holy fuckballs this is amazing. Its like a cinnamon graham cracker.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Oj! OJ! Trochę mniej gęsty Agamemnon Bourbon BA. Petarda! Pięknie ułożone, kawa, czekolada, cynamon, syrop klonowy... Wybitne piwo.

On tap at Hops & Pie. Deep, dark brown appearance with a small tan head. Aroma of big cinnamon, coffee, bourbon, vanilla and light toasted oak. Similar flavor, adding moderate malt sweetness with light alcohol and a lingering cinnamon finish. Pretty tasty overall, but slightly underwhelming compared to its rating.

Pours dark brown from a bottle with minimal beige head. Aroma is bourbon, coffee, chocolate and cinnamon. Flavor is sweet bourbon with just the right amount of coffee and cinnamon mixed in. Wonderful molasses flavor in the background. This is a really great beer. Mouthfeel is thick but not overly so. Definitely lives up to the hype.

Bottle thanks to Ben. pours dark brown with a thin tan head. strong oak, vanilla, and cinnamon nose. dark chocolates, coconut, and fruit flavors from the light roast coffee. average carbonation, medium mouthfeel.

Backlog rating.
650ml bottle @ home. Pours a rich dark brown colour with a small tan head. Nose is sweet coffee, dark fruits, and boozy bourbon. Flavour is delicious! Chocolate, coffee, light cinnamon, with a sweet yet warming vanilla bourbon finish.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4, many thanks! Poura very dark brown. Aroma is strong, sweet and boozy, malty. Some coconut. Strong barley, heavy heavy body, sweet without getting vulgar or boring or sticky. Palate is still sweet, but not as sweet as feared. Very nice, and worth the hype.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 Bottle, my 1000th brewery. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is coffee, just a touch of cinnamon, boozy, green pepper, lots of chocolate as well, coconut, a touch of chili, more the flesh - not really though, its hard to describe. Very rich. Taste is the same, very rich and complex. Medium carbonation. Very rich aftertaste. Amazing.

On tap at Elizabeth station.
Vuntage 2014. Pours a very dark brown with a weak beige head. Aroma is very complex - vanilla, fruitiness, bourbon, sweetness, chcolate. Taste is the same with some coffee and chocolate notes. Very smooth. 14% ABV? No way. Incredible!
Vintage 2016. Aroms is pretty the same. Taste is different though - with lots of cinnamon notes. Same incredible stuff, though.

Black with some tan head. Nose is lots of cinnamon, raisin, date, and bourbon. Taste is coffee, bourbon, cinnamon, raisins, vanilla, oak, and tobacco. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice, a good infusion on a great beer.

On Tap black with dense brown head. Tons of chocolate tootsie roll and a littel cinnamon. Not much coffee. Lots of sweetness and almost stcky at the end. Some of the barrel aged flavors as well. Very tasty.

Thanks to Matt for this great brew! Vintage 2014 partagé en compagnie dAlexandre. Robe très foncée aux couleur caramel et de miel brun. Une mousse plus quhonnête pour ce niveau dalcool se forme en surface. Le liquide ne colle cependant pas au verre, mais ça na aucune importance: cest beau et annonciateur de volupté et décadence. Une quantité impressionnante de cannelle et de bourbon rond et brun envahit tant mes narines que mes papilles. Un corps très rond (peut-être un peu trop, menfin), un café qui a perdu ses éclats de jeunesse mais dont la charpente moléculaire est encore bien perceptible. Longue en bouche, très sucrée et riche en ce dimanche après-midi où cette bouteille de 660ml est partagée entre deux convives qui nen sont pas à leur premier verre.

22oz bomber 2014 vintage pours black with finger of dark tan head. Holding up superbly well, nose and taste have rich sweet roasty chocolate, bourbony vanilla, coconut, nice balanced cinnamon and spice adds a drying element and hints of earthy coffee bring in another layer. This is super tasty stuff even at this age.

Oh noes, it is the abominable ale. 
Pour is murky muddy black, with as good as no head. 
Aroma is jam packed with all kindzz of goodness - boozy bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut, plenty of barrel, chocolate covered grilled n candied banana dipped In bourbon, slight spicy cinnamon, slight ground coffee. A whole lot going on in this abominable bitch. 
Taste is pretty sweet, with some balancing bitter notes to it as well. Very well made. 
Semi full bodied, with an oily body that fits this bad boy nicely. Great stuff for sure

2014 bottle thanks to Ryan. Pours dark like a stout almost. So a deep reddish brown maybe with only a thin ring of foam. Noses like christmas cake with a cup of black coffee with a dram of straight bourbon on the side and a Caribien lady freshly lotioned up with coconut oil just walked by. Its that good. Taste is as intense as a bcbs barleywine but 10% more drinkable.. And not nearly as sweet. Slightly more roasted. The mouthfeel is full and slightly oily. Aftertaste of coconut, barrel character, dark cinnamon chocolate and oak.. Love it.

On tap. 2014 vintage. Pours black with almost no head. Aromas of chocolate and mixed spice with dry toast malts. Flavors follow - rich and dry - like a German chocolate cake - with layers of dry chocolate, coconut, very dry black coffee, lots of roasted malts, and a melange of spice - cinnamon is not overbearing. Beauty.

August 5, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2014, @Sommarprovning, thanks for sharing!
Dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is malty and quite spicy with caramel, toffee, figs, bourbon, cinnamon, toasted coconuts, vanilla and ground coffee. Taste is sweet, malty, smooth bitter, spicy and light warming notes. Finish is sweet caramel, figs, spicy cinnamon, oak, toasted coconut, vanilla and warming bourbon notes. Medium to full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. 
Smoother than the BA one and very nice balance of the spices.
22oz bottle pours a murky black with some creamy, white head. Nose has spice, cinnamon, anise, coffee, chocolate. Flavor is sweet with chocolate, vanilla, malt, mild spice. Sweet finish. Very solid.

22 oz. bottle shared by Prufrockstar - thanks again, Chris! 2015 vintage. Pours an opaque coffee brown with a moderate khaki head that settles into a ring. Notes of cinnamon, pepper, oak, chocolate, tobacco, earth, coffee, caramel, and vanilla. The spice seems to lead the sweetness here, with a deep oaky and earthy character underneath it all. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a spicy mouthfeel. Good, interesting stuff. Im sure this changes a lot throughout its lifespan.
Bomber thanks to prufrockstar - nose is oak, vanilla, coffee and booze. Sip adds cinnamon. Complex.

Fresh batch. Reddish mahogany, clear with minimal head. Nose is vanilla, rich caramel and toffee, oak, and cinnamon. Taste is sweet, but coffee provides some balancing bitterness. Flavors follow the rich, complex nose. Warming finish. Great stuff.

2015 bottle (thanks to Lifeisstout for getting me this one). A wonderful, heady aroma of earthy coffee (with just hint of green pepper), minor cinnamon, heavy biscuit, and a touch of hot whiskey rises up from the glass and only becomes more enjoyable as the beer warms. Pours flat black with a paper-thin tan head. The coffee flavor is slightly vegetal but a decent cinnamon level (moderate spice) that pleasantly lingers carries it away. Biscuit, cocoa, mild oak, and solid bourbon notes beautifully complement each other. A fantastic variant of an already great beer.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl via cgarvieuk dregs run.
Appearance - dark brown to black with decent head. 
Nose - coffee and chocolate with a film of cinnamon over the top.
Taste - serious sweet tooth and reminiscences of childhood. Toffee with definite I want candy thing going on. A melded chocolate and sweetie thing for sure.
Palate - full bodied with a rich texture through the middle section and a decent tangy yet sweet finish.
Overall - loads of stimulation with this one. Crowded olifactory.

Very dark brown, lush light sandy head and oily lacing. Nose is rich sticky coconut, soft spice. Initial taste has a rich sticky molar melting choc. Carbonation is soft enough and a very sticky mouthfeel. Finishes chewy, light spice and fading Christmas warmth despite the ABV.Bottle fae Garvie Florist Haul, Pig Our Tasting.

Bottle thanks to Garvie! Pours brown shade of black with a light brown head. Aroma is coffee, cinnamon, vanilla, leather, oak. Taste is cinnamon, coffee, cocoa, vanilla, chocolate sweet, christmas spices, caramel, hint of oak.

From notes. Enjoyed at the 3rd Annual Barleywine Tasting at Traviss house on February 20. 22 oz bottle, I didnt get the vintage. The pour of this looks awesome. Its a dark, dark brown with a thin cap of light brown head that falls to a collar, leaving a couple legs of lace. The aroma is spectacular. There is a nice bourbon up front, but then a lovely coffee rolls through. There is a ton of cinnamon and a surprising coconut. I definitely didnt see that coming. There is a little barrel, a light vanilla, and a decent char. Fremont wins. The flavor is a little more focused on the cinnamon, but its still got a good complexity. The coffee and the sweet caramel are nice. There is a bitter coffee roast on the back end that almost makes me think of an imperial stout. The mouth feel is thick and heavy with a soft velvety carbonation and a lingeringly sweet malt that finishes with cinnamon and a little bitter. Its just complex and great.

Had this a few times now from bottle and on tap, but tonight got a nice pour at the taphouse and devoted the needed time for a brew of this complexity... Thick and dark brownie batter spiked with chocolate covered espresso beans and a sweet spicy cinnamon blanket that ties everything together... Very warm from front to back with the EtOH and the spicy bark... Very proper... I dont normally care for cinnamon in beers, but it definitely works with this setting.

Bottle to tulip glass. Velvety dark brown with mocha head. Aroma is cinnamon, coffee, mocha, toasted coconut, bourbon, vanilla. Taste is a decadent treat that through some miracle of science doesnt get too sweet. Smooth palate with slightly high carbonation. Overall outstanding.

2014 bottle from Prufrockstar - thanks Chris!! Dark brown pour with a slight tan head. Really nice nose on this - massive cinnamon with some coffee and bourbon in there, almost a coconut thing going on as well. Nice thick mouthfeel, strong on the cinnamon spice followed up by some nice coffee and bitter chocolate finishing warm and a little sweet with bourbon. Really nice.

Sample, 1-ounce, during the Great American Beer Festival, savoured on September 24 2015; eye: black, opaque, thin sheet of beige head, slight lacing; nose: roasted barley, coffee, light cinnamon, bourbon, woody, vanilla, light hops; mouth: roasted barley, coffee, light cinnamon, bourbon, woody, bittering hops, slight burnt barley, finale in roasted barley with presence of coffee, full body, average carbonation, mildly sweet, surprisingly bitter, lightly harsh texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Échantillon, 1 once, en fût, durant le Great American Beer Festival, savourée le 24 septembre 2015; il : noire, opaque, mince couverture de mousse beige, très légère dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, café, léger cannelle, bourbon, boisé, vanille, léger houblon; bouche : orge torréfiée, café, léger cannelle, bourbon, boisé, vanille, houblon amérisant, très léger orge brûlée, finale en orge torréfiée avec présence de café, corsée, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, curieusement amère, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien bon
Bottle share. Nose is coffe, caramel and cinnamon. Pours jed black with very small head. Taste is bitter chocolate, coffee, licorice. Very nice!

2014 bottle poured into a snifter..jet black with a thin tan head..aroma of coffee,bourbon,vanilla,spices..tastes of bourbon,coffee,vanilla,cinnamon &
licorice..worth the wait.

Backlog 150806, thanks Angst for sharing!
Very nice beer! Vanilla, cinnamon, coffee shines through. Love it!

From 22 ounce bottle to wine glass
Appearance: Dark -black brownish on the edges if held against the light
Aroma: Smell coffee and sweetness like caramel. 
Taste: Excellent, smooth, not a lot of bitterness
Mouth fell: smooth buttery
Overall: Excellent beer, but a bit expensive even from Costco at 13.99

Bomber poured a clear dark reddish brown with a small lingering tan head. Aromas of cinnamon, coffee, roasted malt and dark chocolate. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of cinnamon, dark chocolate, coffee and bourbon with a smooth dry lingering cinnamon chocolate finish.

The beer is black with a beige head. It really looks like a stout. Pretty good head retention. Some lacing. The head fades to a thin layer pretty quickly. The aroma is rich and full of milk chocolate and caramel. Delicious brownies with cinnamon and coffee. Very tasty stuff. The feel is smooth and full. Theres a lot of rich maltiness to the beer. The cinnamon and coffee is actually on the mild side, but its still noticeable and blends in perfectly with the rest of the flavors. Slight burn. Just some cinnamon. Its fairly sweet but it works for the beer and never gets cloying or sticky. Just a big, rich sipper. I had this beer recommended to me by friends, but I didnt expect it to be quite this good. Fantastic stuff.

Nose of coffee and cinnamon with sweet boozy bourbon wood vanilla and sweeter dark malts. Dark brown pour nice tannish head. Flavors of bourbon up front followed by coffee and cinnamon balanced toasted malt sweetness, vanilla wood and warming alcohol. 14% is hidden well. Smooth nice enjoyable.
Bomber. Pours Jet Black with Brownish Tan head. Aroma is Coffee and Whiskey. Taste is Chocolate, Coffee and Whiskey with Cinnamon, Alcohol and Whiskey finish. Excellent beer.

Draft at the brewery. Predictably similar to the regular B-Bomb in many ways, with the same dark brown pour and rich malt tones. The coffee and cinnamon do mesh nicely with the vanilla character from the barrel, but the cinnamon does overpower the coffee and much of the other nuance on the palate. Still, the adjuncts are delicious, tough to argue with. Definitely a sipper, but a good one.

Woops, forgot to rate this when I had the bottle. Draft this time around, at the Collective, as part of the Fremont brewers night/fundraiser. Is cool to be able to drink a beer like this for a good cause. Near black or with a dark brown fizz head. Aroma is coffee beans, with a subtle vanilla and bourbon. This is a total cinnamon bomb. No pun intended. Well.. maybe it was. Definitely more cinnamon than coffee. Huge cover up on the base beer. Good thing the cover flavor is very tasty. Finishes like a cinnamon sugar cookie, with a late bourbon presence. There is a word i would like to use to describe this beer as an overall sum, but I cant quite figure it out. So Ill use one I havent used before. This beer was exceptional. And delicious.
Bottle shared by a friend. Pours darkest brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate and bourbon. Malty and chocolatey flavor with cinnamon spiciness before a warm bourbon finish.

650ml bottle (v2014) from trade with bytemesis, shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Thank you Mike! Black color with brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, some caramel, spicy, cinnamon, fruits, dried fruits, coconut, vanilla, wood, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter like aroma. Full almost creamy body with soft carbonation. I want more!
A bit of ageing took edge off cinammon and bourbon. Cinammon and coffee certainly there. A bit woody and sticky.Pretty tasty though not something I would seek out again.

Type: 22-oz. bottle
Glass: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Reserve snifter glass 
From: Beer Advocates mschantz
Price: N/A
Purchased: N/A; Received on Feb. 16, 2015
Consumed: Oct. 2, 2015
Misc.: 2014 release; Gold waxed neck/head

Thanks Mike!

Poured a pitch black color with 1-to-2 fingers of rocky, tan head. Average amount of spotty lacing on the sides of the glass. Above average retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled dark cocoa nibs, dark chocolate, boozy, bourbon, chocolate syrup, oaky wood, toffee, crayon, bitter coffee malts, caramel, almost Rolos candy, chocolate raisins, coconut (so maybe Mounds candy) and faint unknown wintry spice late. Just awesome. (Smell - 4.75)

Taste followed the nose nicely. Got dark cocoa, dark chocolate, oaky wood, bourbon, Rolos, coconut, Mounds, Raisinets, coffee malts, milk chocolate, Mexican chocolate and light cinnamon stick. Amazing. (Taste - 4.50)

Full body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth, warming finish. (Feel - 4.75)

This was one of the best beers Ive ever had. Wow. Just amazing. (Overall - 4.75)

4.61 100 A+

Pours dark brown with a beige head. The aroma has coffee, heavy roast, bourbon, cinnamon and fudge. It has a full rich body with soft carbonation. The flavor has lots of coffee, chocolate, cinnamon, fudge and spiciness. The finish dried things out a lot. Excellent beer.

Bottle shared while at Brouwers. Pours deep dark brown color with a small off white head. Aroma is massive cinnamon and some light coffee, bourbon, sweet caramel. Flavor follows closely with huge cinnamon caramel flavors bursting through oaky bourbon and some earthy coffee in the backdrop. Rich and thick bodied, medium carbonation. This was excellent.

Bottle at What the Funk?! 2015. Pour is pitch black with a small brown head and good lacing. Big coffee, peppers, light spice, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, sweet fudge, brownie batter, and vanilla aroma. Taste is brownies, cocoa, somewhat bready, cinnamon, burnt sugar, caramel, espresso, and peppers with a little bit of heat on the back-end. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Rich and very decadent - almost wish it had a little more spice and pepper presence, but still delicious.

GABF 2015 and WTF 2015. Bunch of pours. Black appearance with a nice brown head. Chocolate, vanilla, caramel, German chocolate-like notes like the original but this also had a little more spice and an even a little bit of olives in the nose. Ill take the BA Abominable over this by far.

Bottle for rating #6400: &nbsp Nearly black, moderate to large dark beige head, fairly nice lacing. &nbsp Strong dark chocolate aroma, coffee, bourbon, and of course some cinnamon. &nbsp Assertive cinnamon up front, dies down once it warms up and then the bourbon takes hold. &nbsp Coffee is there, seems a bit more subdued than the nose suggested. &nbsp Dark chocolate from start to finish. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Very warming, a bit alcoholic at times. &nbsp Extremely tasty, and very much a sipper. &nbsp Could stand to wait a bit on this one as it feels a touch young, but still oh so good.

22oz bottle thanks to Darrel. Pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is great roast malt heavy sweetness booze coffee vanilla cinnamon. Taste is more of the sweetness heavy roast malts coffee vanilla barrel cinnamon wow this is amazing.

bottle shared by a friend. poured a dark brown colour with a mocha coloured head. another huge Bbomb!, nose is filled with roasted notes, oily caramel, spiced, sweet bakers chocolate, sticky bourbon, charred oak, nutmeg, and dry cinnamon, cookie dough, and vanilla from the oak. the mouthfeel is very full bodied. very good! really awesome stuff
2014 bomber. Thanks Jim. Bourbon dominant. Very roasty, touch of cinnamon. Bourbon kind of covers up the cinnamon.

Thick brown stuff with a tan head. Aroma is chocolate and cinnamon, slightly smoky. Bitter chocolate, with warming alcohol and a nice cinnamon finish, not really a ton of coffee, but its quite delicious

Bottle thanks to Kevin for the share. Aroma is incredible. Cinnamon, coffee, nutmeg, chocolate cake, and cookies. Tastes like cinnamon coffee cake. Wow. Ultra smooth, bourbon is subtle in the finish. So awesome.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2015 Courtesy of 5000 via trade
Bottle: The aroma consists caramel, toffee, cinnamon, light coffee, and bourbon. Its a dark brown with no transparency and a small beige head that fades to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of chocolate, caramel and and toffee. The finish has moderate-heavy cinnamon, light-moderate vanilla, bourbon, and a touch of coffee. Its medium-full bodied with mild carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel.

Dark brown to black pour with a brownish head. The aroma is great with some nice chocolate and roasted malt notes. The flavor is a bit more complex. I get a heavy dose of cinnamon and chocolate, with some oak, whiskey, roasted malt and cream coming through. I also get some big toffee and caramel malt in the flavor. Medium, creamy carbonation and thick mouthfeel.

(Bottle) Pours near black with a small brown head. The aroma is balanced boatloads of bourbon, clear cinnamon and coffee tones, some resinous hops and wet tobacco. Undertones of dark fruits, brown sugar burned wood. The flavour is near heavily sweet, medium to heavily bitter and tiny acidic with coffee, oak/bourbon, spices, dark fruits, roast,brown sugar and piny/earthy/woodsy hops. The mouthfeel is soft, light tart and round with a light to medium carbonation. Numbing finish. Near full bodied.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Bottle received in trade. Thank you Bytemesis! Pours deep reddish brown with a rather small creamy goldenish beige head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and slightly spicy with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, toasted coconut, caramelised pecans, cinnamon, chocolate covered raisins, nespresso, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter, malty and spicy. Mouthfeel is fat, round, oily, velvety, boozy and full bodied. Finish is sweet and slightly bitter with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, toasted caramelised nuts, cinnamon, chocolate covered raisins and cherries, coffee, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Amazing stuff and not even close to as hot as the regular BBA version! Malt dream with lovely cinnamon and coffee integration!

Draught at Sommarprovning 2015-08-05. Black beer with a nice brownish head. Malty caramel aroma, cinnamon, caramel, toffee, coffee notes, raisins, chocolate, licorice notes. Cinnamon and vanilla flavor, caramel, toffee, warming alcohol, licorice, raisins and prunes, some coffee. Full bodied and well balanced. The cinnamon really adds to the beer.
Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small brownish head. Aroma is sweet caramel fruity roasted coffee cinnamon. Flavor is velvety smooth coffee cinnamon sweet roasted bitter caramel, very nice.

Bottle curtesy of the Tampa crew. Pours a heavy stout brown with a tan head. Nose is roast, earth, espresso, cinnamon, spice, and dark chocolate. Flavor is similar with roast, earth, coffee, spice, and chocolate with a medium body and lingering earthy coffee and spice into the finish.
Dark pour nice alcohol legs. Aroma whiskey, coffee, cinnamon, big milky, slight leather.. Tastes wood coconut, caramel, choco. Nice slight hop bitter finish theyve been doing this for years.

Pours a dark brown with a small beige head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of coffee and spices, as advertised. Taste is of coffee, chocolate, moderately sweet and cake-like. Body is full, carbonation low to moderate and mouthfeel is syrupy. Overall a really nice american strong, rich and tasty without tasting of raw alcohol.

Bottle 22oz.
Pours black with medium beige head. Good lacing. Aroma is of coffee, strong alcohol, bourbon, roasted malt, chocolate. Taste is of coffee, sugar, spices, roasted malt, some ashes/bugs. Palate: Full bodied. Medium carbonation. Sticky on the lips. Overall: Quite nice. A sipper. Not too cloying.

Bottle (22 oz). From Lurkaholic, thanks! Split with the Québec & Trois-Rivières crew. 

Appearance: Dark brown (almost black) with a small but thick tan head, good retention and little lacing. 

Aroma: The nose is really intense and decadent with a burst of fresh coffee (but not vegetal), loads of cinnamon, deep caramel presence, bourbon, vanilla, rich dark chocolate, nutmeg... super complex and surprisingly cohesive. 

Taste: Taste is rich and sweet without being cloying with again loads of coffee and spices (mostly cinnamon) supported by a good malt backbone, rich caramel, chocolatey notes, oak, vanilla, bourbon and alcohol. 

Palate: Full body. Moderate to medium carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. A bit less "full" than the fantastic mouthfeel of the bourbon & coffee version of their dark star. Warming finish. Lingering spiciness. 

Overall: I have been really impressed by Fremonts big beers lately. This was mightily tasty and really cohesive considering everything going on in this one. Very good stuff!

Partagée avec Frank. Vintage 2014. Belle tête tenace sur un liquide ténébreux. Délicieux nez cohésif de café, de caramel, de cannelle, de bourbon, de noix de coco, de vanille et de chocolat. Saveurs superbement intégrées : les épices, le café, les malts et le bourbon ravissent grandement mes papilles. Beau corps velouté avec un pétillement assez bas. Finale qui montre quelques notes chaudes et une cannelle qui sétend avec intelligence. Très bon autour dun feu. Presque facile à boire.

pours unclear dark brown with a reviving beige-crema cap, good retention and lacing. toasted/roasted coconut, chalky lactosed coffee - sweetness; sweet nuts, vanilla cream, spicy cinnamon, allspice, perfumey booze. light to low carbonation; medium-full body; sweet and boozy-spicy finish. smooth coffee with a dash of cream and bourbon.

Bottle shared. Deep black pour with thick tan foam. Aroma is super potent, perfumy, cinnamon, tons of coffee, cinnamon, caramel. Taste is rich, sweet, tons of complex spicy flavors, bourbon, coffee. Palate is full bodied with good carbonation,really nice mouthfeel. Delicious.
Bottle. Color is black with soft fluffy tan head. Big sweet cinnamon aroma some chocolate. Taste is so smooth, thick chocolate faint coffee and lots of subtle spiced cinnamon.
Taste at Savor 2015. Nice amount of bourbon, light vanilla, really a treat to have. Thanks Fremont!

22 oz bottle, 2014 vintage- Pours black with a mocha colored head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, molasses, licorice, cinnamon as it warms. The taste is velvety smooth, chocolate, coffee, cinnamon, all well integrated, wood and bourbon too, easy drinking for such a big beer.

What an incredible beer. Bottle, 2014 vintage. Pours black as night with a head of latte-colored froth. Aroma leads with maple syrup and vanilla bean, backed up by cinnamon sugar, oak, cocoa and brown sugar-heavy whiskey. The booze is more apparent in the flavor, leading a charge that consists of graham crackers, cinnamon, fruity coffee beans, toasted oak and yogurt raisins before a roasty finish. A creamy medium body carries these flavors well and carbonation is kept minimal -- present, but not distracting. Alcohol content is noticeable, but thats not surprising at 11 percent. Perfect balance between the cinnamon, coffee, barrel and stout flavors; smooth delivery; outstanding ale.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Sweet, cinnamon and chocolate aromas. Sweet chocolate, cinnamon, spice, bourbon flavors.

2-4 oz bottle pour at SAVOR 2015s Saturday night session. Dark brown with tan head. Aromas of coffee, cinnamon, coconut, caramel. Tastes of same with some bourbon. Full body with a dry finish. Fantastic.

Bottle, 06/03/2015. Pours black, light tan head fades to a fine haze on the surface. Aroma of spicy dark chocolate, cinnamon and caramel cake batter, coffee overtones blending with vanilla and bourbon in the finish. Taste is chocolate malts, medium sweet, with vanilla, cinnamon spices, thin edge of dark roast coffee to balance, bourbon finish, some heat noticeable. Medium body, not too dense but tongue coating. Good flavor combination, nice.

From a 2014 bottle. 
Aroma is rich with a moderately strong coffee note. Some medium light cinnamon notes. Some nice toffee and caramel notes with a hints of toasted bread, chocolate and roast. Light bourbon and oak notes. As it warms there is more cinnamon and chocolate and less coffee and roast. 
Pours dark brown, but not quite black with a medium sized,thick mocha head that slowly recedes to a thin film that is thicker on the edges. Medium lacing and long legs. 
Flavor is slightly to moderately sweet with moderate chocolate, toffee and caramel notes. Light roast and toasted bread. Medium light coffee and cinnamon. Medium bitterness. Medium low bourbon and faint oak. Some light alcohol spice and lingering cinnamon notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice beer. The adjuncts work well with the base beer adding some nice complexity. The coffee works well with the roast and chocolate and the cinnamon works well with the sweeter malt notes and bourbon.
From the bottle. 2014. Big coffee and cinnamon flavors. Aroma of chocolate. Light bourbon in finish. Very nice.

Bottle This beer rocks! Pours murky and dark brown with a small, creamy, khaki head. Good retention. The bouquet features a mélange of toasted coconut, bourbon, deeply roasted and acrid coffee, vanilla and a small ration of cinnamon. Medium to full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation. The flavor is quite roasty, acidic and acrid. Burnt malts and singed caramel in the lightly boozy finish. Thanks goes out to landhoney for generously sharing this world-class brew!

Bottle shared thanks to beerman6686. The highlight of my pre wedding tasting in my book. Pours a dark to medium brown. No real head. Aromas of big cinnamon coffee. Some vanilla and toffee. Really complex. Taste is sweet but not cloying. Super easy to drink. Loved it.

This poured a dark brown to black with a beige head. Aroma was of big cinnamon and coffee, light roast and chocolate, mild barrel. Flavor was like an Irish coffee with cinnamon and chocolate, very tasty, not hot and way too easy to drink for the strength.
Bottle thanks to Dan. Poured almost black with beige head. Aroma sweet tequila char sweet. Light carb med bod. Sweet choc malt taste. Killer

Yes. Ive had this bottle for months and had a couple or more people waiting patiently to find out what I thought of it.  I open the bottle with my snifter close at hand, and fill it with a thick, creamy, dark-chocolate liquid; the cap rises a rich, hot chocolate-hue as I pour. Even the thick, rich head cant inhibit a titillating aroma like this. Cinnamon, almost baked in, and not harsh, or gritty; a deep, soft bourbon accented with an aroma of vanilla before it becomes just an accent; the coffee wafting upwards in tantalizing undertones as I breathe deeply.
I cant help that brews like this remind me of a deep, desperately passionate kiss. Forgive me my few moments alone with my first taste from the glass.
Sigh...Its as creamy as it looks, a touch sticky, soft and rich on the inside of my mouth as I pull another mouthful. The cinnamon is usually such a deterrent for me, harsh and a bit violent; here I am enjoying every drop; every sip is enhanced with maturity and grace. The cinnamon, coffee and vanilla in this are not just additions...infused - yes. Ive seen that on a lot of bottles, but it isnt actually true most of the time.
This beer drinks like passion, breathes decadently, and for me, the greatest taste in a beer...umami. Damnit, I love it; the savory, sultry experience delivers absolutely my favorite olfactory and gustatory orgasm. My suggestion, if you havent had this...buy it. Buy it now and wait...drink not so fresh and enjoy the fuck out of it.

22 oz bottle. Dark brown with a pocked tan head. Nose is coffee bean, caramel, bourbon and wood with a growing cinnamon nasal singe. Silky body with a tongue tickling sparkle. Chocolate champagne? Taste is dark chocolate, French roast, vanilla, caramel and raisin with a soothing bourbon cinnamon finish. Coconut notes as it warms. Wow!

2014 bottle shared by GothGargoyle. Thanks! Pours a deep brown. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, cinnamon, wood, bourbon, raisin, marshmallow. Taste is a perfect balance of sweet bitterness, sweet forward. Palate is creamy, low carbonation, super smooth, and soft dry finish.
22 ounce bottle. Pours black with a decent tan head. Interesting aroma of chocolate, bourbon, and cinnamon. Taste is chocolate, cinnamon, bourbon, coffee, malt, and vanilla. Wish I had more!

Bottle shared at pre-CBC tasting at Fermentoren. A tiny pour from someone. Pitch black with a tan head. Nose is super sweet, cinnamon and coconut. Taste is fairly sweet, coffee, savoury licorice and lots of cinnamon and coconut.

Bottle shared at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Thanks to Lasse Lervik for pouring me a glass of this. Pours pitch black with a medium fuzzy dark brown head. Aroma is dusty, licorice, coconut, light cinnamon, spice, chocolate, roast, vanilla, caramel. Taste is pretty much a coconut spice bomb, lots of caramel, licorice, chocolate, dark fruits, vanilla, fudge. Damn nice.

Ah Yes : B-Bomb - This is a fun one and certainly didnt disappoint. However! - I havent had anything else from the series as reference. It pours dark brown, with amber highlights into this glass - a modest khaki head with average retention. The nose is roast / coffee bean , vanilla and barrel notes with feint caramel notes and only a touch of bourbon. The flavor profile reveals more coffee - well - its perhaps one of the heavier elements of this brew. A touch of cinnamon, a bit of vanilla, with earthen barrel, moving to caramel toffee, with another touch of bourbon - It drinks nicely, its balanced fairly well - and ultimately - a fun ride!

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland ! Pours a thick lush viscous umber color with a finger of khaki foam. Nice spicy cinnamon, bourbon and fudge on the nose. Flavors all come together nicely with layers of fudge, spicy vanilla some booze bourbon keeps it from getting sticky and its more silky in mouthfeel. Tasty treat !

Bottle shared by Ajax, dude this brewery rocks hard! Im blown away that more people dont know more about this brewer. Quality after quality brews I have sampled from this brewery. Aroma is cinnamon forward with nice mellow bourbon with hints of chocolate. The Mouthfeel is smooth and has a creamy texture. Taste is Amaze Balls, Amaze balls no BS. The flavor is really damn good. The cinnamon is down played with a great amount of smooth bourbon and chocolate. Yet again, another home run from Fremont, truly great stuff.

Thanks BVC for sending! Bomber, 2014 split with AFH and Headur.

A - Pours a dark red, pitch black, 1 finger head. 

S - This smells amazing! Cinnamon is very prominent. coffee, not so much. Milk Chocolate aroma, some rye, spice and herbs. 

T - Sweet, toffee, tons of very well integrated cinnamon, good fresh coffee. Insanely delicious 

M - Dense, sugary sweet, oily. good finish.

O - If you missed Goose Island Prop 2014, then grab a bottle of this. Its just as good and without any hype. Its NOT an Imperial stout but taste-wise, youre getting a lot of Prop qualities.

If I could drink one for dessert every night, that would almost be enough. I definitely understand it being a little too much for some people. Huge flavor but perfectly balanced. Beautiful tan head. Smells like a cool November day.

Tasting at MattsDark color, almost black, with frothy beige head. The aroma is spicy, understandably dusty, some tobacco, coconut, roasted nuts and coffee. Boozy mouthfeel, mix of chocolate and coconut flavor, the sweetness is low, the cinnamon is light, but its too boozy. Good but messy.

This beer pours a thick black color with a small light tan head that fades to a ring, but that ring sticks with the beer until the glass is empty. The aroma is heavenly; coffee beans, milk chocolate, cocoa powder, and cinnamon hit your nose first, but booze and bourbon come later, reminding the nose of the beers heft. The taste is mildly sweet, mildly umami, and slightly bitter with an aftertaste reminiscent of a Mounds candy bar dusted with cinnamon. The palate fuses an oily texture, medium-full body, and a nearly flat carbonation.
Bottle shared at Anchorage Feb 15 Tasting: Poured black brown with a thin brown head. Aroma and taste was very cinnamon with roast/caramel malts, bourbon, chocolate, and coffee bean.
crushed it right here, how do you improve an already amazing bb stout? Add coffee and cinnamon. Amazing stuff right here.

Poured from bottle to glass. Dark hue with creamy brown head that settled. Aroma is caramel, cinnamon, coffee, ethanol, toffee, chocolate. Mouthfeel is great with a full body and crisp carbonation. Taste is sweet with a spicy following and slightly bitter/ethanol finish. Overall this is a nice brew.

[3/2/15] Draught at Fremont Brewing in Seattle. Nitro. Dark brown with a creamy tan head. Aroma of lots of cinnamon, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, some coffee, caramel and nuts. Sweet flavor with bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, lots of cinnamon, some coffee, hazelnuts and a boozy finish. Full-bodied.

Black body with medium to thin light tan head, spotty lacing. Bittersweet chocolate, some fudge, well-balanced roasted coffee, cinnamon, oak, vanilla, bourbon, and earth. Medium to full bodied, gentle carbonation, mild sweetness, lingering finish. Well-crafted.

Bottle. Pours black with smaller head. Notes of cocoa, cinnamon sticks, wood, bourbon, gingerbread, vanilla and light smoke. Almost Christmas in a bottle. Somewhat easy going for 11pct, I noticed a lot of similarities to barrel aged Abraxas which is one of my faves for the style. Excellent
Bottle thanks to Ferris. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of coffee, cinnamon, woody vanilla, bourbon, oak, roasted dark chocolate and caramel toffee. Full body.

Bottle split at Bruces, big thanks to our host with the most, 29/01/15.
Black with a decent tan covering that retains well.
Nose is big on coffee grinds, sweet malt, spice, light charr, coconut shavings, rich chocolate.
Taste comprises rich roast, spice, vanilla, cinammon evident, coffee, Bounty bar, chocolate fudge.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, light booze in the close.
Top draw, decadent stuff, well joined up and drinks below the ABV.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle generously shared by Seth. Dark Brown pour with a light brown head. Cinnamon, caramel, milk chocolates, and dark roasted malt highlights. Oak, vanilla, bourbon, and expresso lowlights. Wonderful body and mouthfeel.
Bottle - dark black. Coffee, cinnamon, oak and bourbon nose. Nice chocolate fudgy taste with bourbon and cinnamon. Everything is nicely balanced.

On nitro at the brewery. Beeeeautiful pour. This is dessert in a glass. One word comes to mind: *balance.* The coffee and cinnamon pull each other in different directions while both adding wonderful dimension to an already-delicious brew, neither exerting too much force over the other. Its warm, like really good espresso, super-smooth, and utterly delicious. Not sure Id want more than a goblet of this, but those 12oz are something to write home about.
Bottle..Pour is dark black with a tan head..Nose is cinnamon, spice, coffee, bourbon, sticky, sweet...Taste is bourbon, sticky,oak, coffee, cinnamon, sweet, chewy...

Bottle gifted to me by Prufrock. Thanks!

A: Dark mahogany with a mocha head and good lacing. 

N: Mint, toffee, raisin, bourbon, cinnamon, vanilla, substantial coconut, some coffee, and a touch of honey. 

T: Big sweetness which doesnt grow cloying. A touch of spice.

M: Heavy sticky body, no alcohol presence, crisp carbonation. 

O: This is wonderful. The flavors mesh together extremely well, and I damn near took the bottle back home with me instead of sharing. Seems like a close relative to Termination Dust; whatever the case, get it if you can.

Bottle thanks to Luke. Pours a pitch black color with a large light brown fizzy head. A big sweet nose of toffee, banana, coffee. The flavor is hmmm. how do I describe this: well, it is a hell of a burst of cinnamon bun with a mug o coffee and roasted malts. This is beastly sugary. There is a base yeasty banana flavor. I think this works wonderfully. IMO it might work better with a heavier stout base, but is excellent. Certainly decedent.
Pours jet black with minimal head. Aroma is chocolate, roast, and cinnamon. Flavor us roasted coffee, chocolate malt.

Poured from a bomber into a snifter on 01.26.15.

A: Cinnamon, dark coffee, and vanilla. The coffee smells sweet, not roasty.

A: 2 finger light tan head. Midnight black body with no red in the glass.

T: Dark coffee and cinnamon dominate. Vanilla, nuttiness on the back end, and chocolate are subtle.

P: Medium to low chewiness. Creamy smooth.

O: Cinnamon comes on first, then dark coffee, with vanilla following. The cinnamon was not at all overwhelming. Every flavor was perfectly balanced. Fantastic!
Pours jet black with a thin mocha head. Aroma of roast, slight smoke, cinnamon, chocolate, coffee. Taste is roast, chocolate, coffee, Cinnamon and vanilla.

29th January 2015Tasting at Bruces. Big thanks to Bruce for fhis treat. Opaque dark brown beer, decent yellowish tan head. Very nice coconut snout. Palate is smooth and semi dry with good fine carbonation. Trace of dry cream in the well rounded malts. Mild bourbon spice, toasted coconut follows the nose, little cinnamon. Smooth and slightly spicy finish. Very tasty and would have been an easy 4 if not a tad dry.

Word. So these bourbon abominable beers are pretty awesome. Incredible mouth feels for a style that is usually overly messy with spices and booze and thin as all hell. but not these beers. they are almost like stouts. The cinnamon is more prevalent here than the coffee, but both are evident. good stuff.

Bottle, big thanks to Bruce. It pours jet black with a small tan head. The nose is smooth, chocolate, vanilla, toffee, nougat, cinnamon french toast, creamy, earthy roast and coffee. The taste is smooth, toasty, mild spice, cinnamon french toast, toffee, milky coffee, roasted malt, toasted marshmallow, vanilla milkshake and spice with a dry, lightly warming finish. Super smooth and crazy drinkable. Impressive.

Bottle. Pours black with rich tan head. Aroma is sweet, coffee, coconut, a hint of cinnamon, smells a lot like bourbon county. Taste is rich, smooth, full bodied, medium to low carbonation. Overall, this beer just rocked my world- this is amazing!

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Bruce. Pours lack-brown with a dense, creamy mocha cap. Great aroma, nice cinnamon, chocolate, coconut, toasted bread. Rich flavor, medium to big sweet flavor, lots of dark sugars, stewed fruits, cocoa, soft cinnamon, vanilla. Full bodied with fine carbonation; smooth and lightly chewy. Lightly warming finish with more dark fruits, light syrupy sugars, rich bread, brown sugar, slight bitter coffee, cinnamon accents, vanilla, coconut. Great stuff. Wonderful depth, and highly drinkable.

Gold waxed beauty thanks to pfufrockstar. Pours a deep mahogany with a small creamy tan head that laces well. Aroma is like Christmas morning, lovely notes of cinnamon, coffee, vanilla, toffee, bourbon. Flavor is pretty sweet and lightly bitter, wonderful blend of coffee and cinnamon with nice barrel aging notes without the associated astringency. Medium body, A winner for sure.

Gold wax-dipped bomber. Aroma is vanilla, coconut, raisins, cinnamon, light wood, molasses, brown sugar--reminds me of my favorite barrel-aged beers, a la Firestone Walker. Its perfect. Pours a dark dark brown to black with a small tan head that lasts a minute before collapsing into a ring. And with one sip, this beer glides into one of the top 10 beers Ive ever had in my life. No hyperbole here. This is so fucking good. The barrel imparts that vanilla coconut flavor without an emphasis on booziness like a lot of these types of beers have. There is a light alcohol burn, but its not harsh, just right. I get cinnamon, but its just a hint. I really dont get the coffee, other than the roastiness present that might have come from said coffee. The other strong flavors might be smothering it. Mouthfeel is velvet, carbonation on the low end of average for style, body full. So good. Even though I wish there was more coffee presence, this is as delicious as beer can possibly get, so Im not gonna dock it. This is how its done! If it had a fuller, long-sustaining lacy head, this would have been my first perfect 5 score.
Bottle thanks to Phil/Chow. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head. The aroma is cinnamon, coffee roast, wood. Medium mouthfeel with strong cinnamon, sweet roast, light booze, very nice.

Gold Wax Dipped 2014 Vintage Bomber. Dark brownish black in appearance with a dense layer of tan foam. Aroma is a blend of coffee, vanilla bean, chocolate mocha, cinnamon sticks and molasses. Taste starts with a heavy dose of bittersweet chocolate, bourbon and coconut upfront followed by espresso, cinnamon, Kahlúa and toffee at the end. Mouthfeel is sufficiently thick and creamy with more bourbon barrel and burnt dark sugar/coffee notes in the finish. Overall, a damn fine dessert beer and worthy addition to the Fremont Bourbon Barrel Aged series.

Nice opaque cola pour with no head. This is a nice balanced cinnamon coffee bourbon barrel beer. Totally smith and drinkable. Notes of vanilla, toffee and and bourbon. Balanced and real smooth. Really good BA variant .

Bottle shared at Sante Adairius. Pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma is heavy cinnamon and bourbon. Flavor is more balanced, still heavy on sugar and cinnamon but backed up with malt and body so that it tastes like an indulgent coffee cake. Really nice.

Nitro pour in flight at brewery. Maybe the first time I can say "thank god for nitro." The nitro subdues the over the top barreling to make it at least doable to drink. You can even pick out the cinnamon at that point if you try hard enough.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text:
Thanks Sebastian (sebz on talkbeer).
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a nice dark brown coloring with a thin finger semi-white to off-white head. Once it dissipated, a fairly nice looking lacing appeared gracefully sticky and slight.
The aroma had a sweet to nicely spiced smell. It intertwined nicely weaving through the cinnamon and bourbon barrel and giving off a semi-smooth woodiness I could only hope for more again some day.
The taste was spectacular! Holy wow through the sweet light chocolate and emaculate cocoa flavoring gracefully intertwining in a sticky fashion over my taste buds. A sweet sticky aftertaste leads to a fine semi-dry finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body leaning to a fairly good sipping quality about it. Sticky yet smooth spice rolls over my tongue.
Overall, this is an exceptional brew. Ho-lee Cow, seek this ratebeerians!

Bottle thanks to Chris. Nose is an amazing light chocolate and toffee explosion with a hint of booze/vanilla and cinnamon. Smells like a million dollars. Pour is dark brown with a large light brown head, lots of tiny velvet like bubbles. Taste is a rich toffee with spiced coffee and a moderate vanilla character. Holy cow this is good stuff. Vanilla really starts to come through as you sip it but the cinnamon is always there like a balancing bitterness. Coffee is like a complimentary chocolate at the desk of a hotel, small, nice, neat, well packaged. finishes semi sweet but still making you want more. Alcohol becomes evident after a few more sips with a warming sensation. very smooth

22 oz. bottle, pours a deep dark brown / mahogany with a medium tan head. Nose is rather nasty to be honest, with vomit, cinnamon, and spice. Flavour brings out notes of coconut, cinnamon, and coffee. Rather messy, with notes all over the place. No where close to the classic Bourbon Abominable. The coffee is upfront, but the spicy cinnamon takes over after leaving everything else a distant memory. Interesting beer, but I prefer the base big time.
Bottle - Lots of coconut and chocolate notes. Deep brown with a decent brown head. Cinnamon, dark malts, sweet grains and a roasty sweet finish. Quite nice, I liked it a lot.

22 oz bottle. Many thanks durwoodx for bringing this back. Pours a clear dark brown with a tan head that moves to the edge and leaves thin sugary lacing. Aroma is big and sweeet: cinnamon, bourbon and vanilla sweetness. Flavor is same, with cinnamon leading all aspects. The coffee has proven difficult to find. Alcohol is masked better with this version than regular BAA. Medium to full bodied, muted carbonation, sweet bourbon roast finish. Solid and delicious.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2015 Served alongside Bourbon Abominable. Dark brown body with a small beige cap. Grandiose cinnamon aroma followed by bourbon and vanilla. Spice and booze. Brown sugar and bourbon. Hard to compare this to its counterpart, as they are vastly different. Coffee character is overshadowed. This is a showcase for cinnamon, and while the flavor is tasty, this is definitely best split a few ways. Yum.

On draft at the brewery. Dark pour, almost black, with a thin tan head. Sweet milk chocolate, silky, vanilla bean, brownies, nicely done cinnamon, wood, bourbon, and more smooth chocolate. Silky mouth feel, and the cinnamon is not over the top and works very well with this beer. Excellent, but I think I like the regular bourbon barrel slightly more.

Draft at Beer Authority, Seattle. As C-bomb (ugh). Big, dark and lots of cinnamon that Fremont does so well. Rich aroma, body a little less so. Vanilla and cinnamon spiciness. Rich but missing something in body. I like this a bit more than the usual bourbon abominable.

Tap at the beer authority.

Dark pour, obviously. Cinnamon and vanilla nose with some roast. Flavor brings toasted marshmallow with vanilla, a mild fairly cinnamon, roasty chocolate. All together it works quite a bit better than b-bomb did for me. Though I am admittedly rating this from a much smaller sample, even the first sip of b-bomb put me off whereas this first sip was quite delicious if somewhat sweet and over the top.

Beautiful balance among bourbon, chocolate, roast and cinnamon flavors. There are no chilis in this, but the cinnamon is very assertive and drying, and the over all effect is quite similar to bourbon barrel aged Abraxas, but even more drinkable. Seek this one out, or trade heavily for the chance to savor it.

Black with a chocolate head. Aroma is coffee, bourbon, booze, cinnamon, dark fruit. Full bodied, lightly sticky mouthfeel, nicely integrated booze. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, coffee, cinnamon, vanilla. Yum

22, capped and waxed. Pours a murky dark brown with a dense and creamy tan head. Big sweet nose, showing a dense melange of caramel, brown bread, molasses, dark roasted coffee, soft cinnamon notes, and a bit of fruitcake. Creamy thick body, almost sticky, soft carb. Great interplay between all the sweet notes on the mid palate--caramel, molasses, nougat, treacle, coffee, cinnamon, but amazingly its never heavily cloying or overpowering. Its an after-dinner sipper or cigar beer to be sure, but very coherent and approachable. Lovely beer.

This was delicious! A lot of care went into this beer. Poured wonderful with a nice dark caramelized head that left nice lacing. Tasty imperial stout that paired well with the warming cinnamon, and really tasty oaky bourbon that complement the stout nicely. Would recommend buying 2 one to lay down for 9 months and one to drink
22 ounce bottle shared by Timfoolery at Christmas, mild barrel aroma, spicy finish.

On tap @ Fremont. Pours dark inky brownish black with thin oily dark mocha head. Aroma is big buttery cinnamon on top of the regular roasty dark malts and bourbon of BBomb. Taste is similar, the oaky bourbon barrel-aged dark malts dominate, strong zesty cinnamon note follows. Coffee is present but definitely overwhelmed by the big bourbon flavors here and the cinnamon addition. Tough to argue with the results, clearly it works here.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2015 Draft at Fremont earlier today. Pours clear dark brown with ruby highlights, just like regular BBomb. Aroma: Light coffee roast at the front end which gives way to the usual BBomb flavors (chocolate, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, oak, etc.) and topped off with a thick dose of cinnamon. So, you know, basically what it says it is. Taste: Moderately sweet, decadent, rich; the cinnamon is big, reminding me of a pumpkin-spiced bourbon chocolate syrup. Side-by-side with the standard BBomb, the flavor intensity on this one is stronger. Palate: full body, silky smooth, viscous with soft carbonation. Overall: if cinnamon/coffee is your thing, this is great -- well-integrated, doesnt detract from the original. In my book, theyre both pretty equal from an enjoyment perspective, just different flavors.   Update: when I had this last, it was a beautiful December day, the last day of the quarter. It was sunny and in the 50s, and I was sipping this out on the patio at the brewery with friends while eating fish and chips. It was a great day, and the beer was nearly perfect. Tonight I finished a small glass thanks to Matt, and though the beer is still very nice, its closer to a 3.9-4. I wont knock the rating down or anything, but I wanted to comment for completeness.   bottle shared by BeBeau. Ill be damned if this isnt better than I remember it. Coconut comes into play. Damn. Yum. Bumped to 4.3.
